title: Drawing, "Internatiional Casino: Linoleum Flooring Layout", June 15, 1937
medium: Graphite and orange color pencil on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite
markings: Architect's stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY; see inscription
inscribed: Architect's stamp inscribed in graphite: 546-66; 1/4"=1'-0"; INT. CAS.; SAENGER/6-15-37; 6/15/37, 1, BRECKER / " 2,WEISS / 6/16/37, 5, BRECKER; Inscribed in graphite at center right: LINOLEUM DESIGN/FOR FIRST FLOOR [all underlined]; Inscribed in graphite with descriptions throughout.
dimensions: 35.9 x 83 cm (14 1/8 x 32 11/16 in.), loss at lower right
description: Linoleum flooring layout plan of first floor, International Casino, New York City. Red linoleum covering floor with thin white rubber lines outlining shape of lower bar and extending toward the left and right sides of room.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Internatiional Casino: Linoleum Flooring Layout", June 15, 1937.
June 15, 1937. Graphite and orange color pencil on tracing paper, double ruled border in graphite. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-296.
